description: Thriller Bark is the world's largest ship, originally an island from the West Blue that was somehow cut away and converted into a massive pirate vessel. It wanders the Florian Triangle, using the thick fog to trap passing ships. The island-ship is enormous, featuring forests, mansions, graveyards, and other structures.

keyMoments.title: Thriller Bark Appears
keyMoments.description: Thriller Bark emerges from the thick fog of the Florian Triangle as a massive, ominous structure. The Thousand Sunny is mysteriously pulled toward it.
keyMoments.significance: The debut of Thriller Bark, one of the most unique locations in One Piece and the primary setting for the entire Thriller Bark arc.

keyMoments.title: Thriller Bark's True Nature Revealed
keyMoments.description: Brook explains that Thriller Bark is not a true island but rather the world's largest ship - an island cut from the West Blue and converted into a vessel.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals important world-building information about this unique location and explains why the Log Pose didn't detect it.

keyMoments.title: The Thousand Sunny is Drawn into Thriller Bark
keyMoments.description: The Thousand Sunny is pulled through Thriller Bark's massive gates into the interior of the island-ship.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the crew's official entry into Thriller Bark and the beginning of the arc's main adventure.

historicalSignificance: Thriller Bark is the world's largest ship and serves as Gecko Moria's base of operations. It was originally an island from the West Blue that was converted into a ship through unknown means - an incredible feat of engineering.

statusHistory.description: Wandering the Florian Triangle, trapping ships

notableFeatures: Originally an island from West Blue
Features complete island geography including forests, buildings, and graveyards
Not detectable by Log Pose since it's not a true island
Operates in the Florian Triangle's perpetual fog

description: The Florian Triangle is a mysterious stretch of sea covered in incredibly thick fog that completely blocks out sunlight. It must be sailed through when traveling from Water 7 to Fish-Man Island. The region is notorious for ships mysteriously disappearing - over 100 vessels vanish there annually.

keyMoments.title: Brook's Soul Wandered the Florian Triangle
keyMoments.description: Brook reveals that after his death, his soul spent an entire year wandering through the Florian Triangle's thick fog, unable to find his body due to the poor visibility.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the Florian Triangle as a dangerous, disorienting region where even souls can become lost.

keyMoments.title: Brook Cannot Leave the Florian Triangle
keyMoments.description: Brook explains he must remain in the Florian Triangle because its thick fog blocks out sunlight. If he left and was exposed to sunlight without his shadow, he would be destroyed.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how the Florian Triangle's unique environmental features trap Brook and make it ideal for Gecko Moria's operations.

historicalSignificance: The Florian Triangle is one of the most dangerous regions in Paradise, known for unexplained disappearances. Over 100 ships vanish there every year. The thick fog makes it perfect for Thriller Bark to operate undetected.
notableFeatures: Incredibly thick fog that completely blocks sunlight
Disorienting environment where even souls can get lost
Must be traversed when sailing from Water 7 to Fish-Man Island
Contains massive creatures with red eyes larger than Thriller Bark itself
